item.title: cTune v1.3 released
item.description: It's been a while since the last update so there are a couple of goodies in that one to make up for it along with some bug squashing...

item.title: cTune v1.2 released
item.description: For this release there has been a lot of work done in the UI side as well as the usual bug squashing. Mouse support, Themes and unicode icons are added and are all available from the Configuration menu.

item.title: cTune v1.1 released
item.description: I figured for the new year I'd go back into the guts of ctune. Here's what's new with this update:

item.title: Socket event epoll blocking in linux
Retrospective: cTune v1.0
item.description: This post looks back at the development of ctune, lessons learned along the way and possible functionalities that could be implemented in the future.

item.title: Circular Buffer
item.description: A circular buffer is a really cool fixed-sized FIFO data-structure useful when passing a stream of data from a 'producer' and 'consumer' thread.

item.title: cTune v1.0: Part 3 - Frontstage
item.description: ctune is Linux based internet radio stream player for the console entirely written in C. It uses the RadioBrowser API as a source for searching streams and getting station information.This is part 3 of 3 blog posts detailing the process of designing and implementing cTune's frontend (UI).

item.title: cTune v1.0: Part 2 - Backstage
item.description: ctune is Linux based internet radio stream player for the console entirely written in C. It uses the RadioBrowser API as a source for searching streams and getting station information.This is part 2 of 3 blog posts detailing the process in implementing cTune's backend.

item.title: cTune v1.0: Part 1 - Design
item.description: ctune is Linux based internet radio stream player for the console entirely written in C. It uses the RadioBrowser API as a source for searching streams and getting station information.This is part 1 of 3 blog posts detailing the design philosophy and choices taken for cTune's development.
